I am Sourabh Mhaski, research scholar at Department of Civil Engineering, IIT Delhi.
I am Sourabh Mhaski, a PhD scholar from IIT Delhi

patterns: Tell me about your teaching assistant experience
responses: Sourabh has served as the TA of CVL222: Soil Mechanics & CVL700: Engineering Behaviour of Soils

patterns: Which research areas are you focused in?
What is the tile of your current research thesis?
What is Sourabh Mhaski's research area?
responses: Thesis title: Geodisasters - Simulations and Remedial Measures using Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH)
Sourabh is developing a Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) based numerical framework for solving multiphysics problems, primarily related to geotechnical engineering.

patterns: What are some common geo-disasters that can be simulated
responses: Geo-disasters are one kind of natural hazards, including landslides, debris flows, earthquakes, lique- factions, which can result in serious causalities and economic loss.
Geo-disaster events like landslides; liquefaction; flow slides in waste dumps, dams, ash-ponds, tailings dams, etc., can be simulated
